meanings.definition: To make a shrill, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The cat skirled loudly when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent2: The teapot skirled as the steam escaped.
meanings.sent3: The child skirled with excitement when opening the present.
meanings.sent4: The brakes skirled as the car came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The bird skirled in distress as the predator approached.

meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound, especially of bagpipes
meanings.sent1: The skirling of the bagpipes echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The skirling of the bagpipes added a traditional touch to the ceremony.
